title: Ticket #3982: Teach DaemonCore to listen to multiple command sockets simultaneously
description:
As part of the IPv4/IPv6 mixed mode work (#3538), DaemonCore needs to be able to listen to multiple command sockets simultaneously. As it happens, DaemonCore already does, but:

  • it privileges the first command socket it creates as the one it advertises, and in a few other places.
  • it doesn't create multiple sockets initially. The other sockets are special cases (a specially requested socket for SOAP, a dedicated socket for shadows to talk to).

Work plan:

  • DONE.... Eliminate special tracking of the first command socket. For backward compatibility, allow easy identification of what would have been returned in the past. [37826]
  • DONE.... Track a list of socket pairs (UDP+TCP) instead of just one pair. [37911] [37927]
  • DONE.... Teach DaemonCore::InitCommandSockets to return a list of pairs (but only actually return one pair) [37826]
  • DONE.... Ensure all callers to InitCommandSockets handle it correctly (excepting DaemonCore::Create_Process)
  • DONE.... Ensure DaemonCore::Create_Process allows all created command sockets to be inherited, not just two. [37826]
  • DONE.... Ensure DaemonCore::Inherit is prepared to take a list of sockets, not just two. [37826]
  • DONE.... Teach ReliSock/SafeSock to use protocol passed in, not to automatically decide. [38758]
  • DONE.... Teach InitCommandSockets to listen on both protocols by default if enabled and listening to *. [38795] [38793]
  • WORKING. Test mixed mode collector receiving updates and queries from both protocols.
  • ........ Teach DaemonCore to listen on both protocols by default if enabled and listening to *.
  • ........ Check if there are sockets we should not be advertising. Ensure we don't flag them for general use. The sockets created by the schedd for shadows leap to mind.
  • ........ Ensure "Get my own Sinful" code gets the entire list of sockets, even if right now it only uses the first one.
  • ........ Eliminate any use of the "get first command socket" backward compatibility.
  • ........ Better integrate superport? At least stuff it into a SockPair?

The requirement for an approved design document in advance has been waived as it was deemed too time critical to wait for. DesignDoc is more what you'd call "guidelines" than actual rules.

counted_ptr works fine, and doesn't unnecessarily drag in classad specific stuff (even if the ClassAd specific stuff is just a thin wrapper around STL/Boost functionality).

Really we need classad_shared_ptr to be copied into utils, perhaps as condor_shared_ptr. Then replace counted_ptr's use. But that's a different ticket.
